Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of officer's assessment and procedural fairness
Evidence_Assessment: Language proficiency, job offer in unrelated field
Burden_of_Proof: Applicant to demonstrate likelihood of economic establishment
Credibility_Factor: Applicant's language skills and employment prospects
Legal_Rule: Officer's decisions reviewed for reasonableness; procedural fairness requires notice and opportunity to respond
Procedural_Issue: Whether procedural fairness was upheld during decision-making
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged breach of procedural fairness and error in economic establishment assessment
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No breach; applicant received pre-refusal letter and responded
Key_Evidence_Considered: Language test results, job offer in unrelated occupation
Legal_Framework: Canadian immigration law, administrative law principles
Applicant_Challenge: Insufficient language proficiency cited as basis for refusal
Legal_Rule_Source: IRPA, case law on procedural fairness
Defendant_Response: Officer considered all submissions and applied correct legal standard
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, application forms, job offer letter
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review setting aside the refusal
Remedy_Sought: Overturning of refusal and approval of application
Authority: Canada Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
Claimant_Status: Skilled worker applicant under economic class
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA s. 11(1) - factors for assessing economic establishment
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Unlikely to become economically established in Canada
Applicable_Process: Two-stage officer review with pre-refusal engagement
Outcome_of_Review: Decision confirmed as reasonable and procedurally fair
Governing_Rule: Duty of procedural fairness in administrative decision-making
